newsitem.title: USA: FPA Medical to buy AHI Healthcare.
newsitem.headline: FPA Medical to buy AHI Healthcare.

text.p: FPA Medical Management Inc said it reached a definitive agreement to buy AHI Healthcare Systems in a stock-for-stock merger.
It said the combined company will have pro forma combined revenues of about $1 billion.

The merger will be accounted for as a pooling of interests, with each share of AHI Healthcare to be exchanged for $8.75 worth of FPA Medical common shares. That rate of exchange is subject to adjustment in the event the value of FPA common stock is less than $14.38 per share, or greater than $22.38.
FPA said it plans to issue about 6.1 million shares of its common stock valued at about $130 million based on its November 8 closing price.

AHI Healthcare integrates individual and small groups of primary care physicians and specialists into comprehensive local managed healthcare delivery networks and had more than 200,000 HMO enrollees as of September 30.
Following completion of the propsed merger, FPA expects to provide services to over 800,000 enrollees in 25 states.
